str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a presumed derivative of pathos; something undergone, i.e. Hardship or pain; subjectively, an emotion or influence.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From energes; to be active, efficient.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A bodily organ, limb, member. Of uncertain affinity; a limb or part of the body.
To bear fruit. From karpophoros; to be fertile.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
